parameters.text:
=Your Goal: Write one authentic, human-sounding LinkedIn comment for a post, speaking as an individual from our company, make sure to check if the post is for example for hiring new people, don't comment on that, just return cannot comment(reason: hiring post).

Your Input: You'll receive a summary of a LinkedIn post. You should act as if you've already read our company's brand profile.

Your Task: Based on the post summary, write a single comment (usually 1‚Äì3 sentences) that is:

    Personal & Conversational: Use a casual, professional tone. Write from your own perspective using "I" and "my." Contractions ("I've," "it's") are great.

    Valuable: Go beyond "Great post!" Share a quick insight from your experience, ask a thoughtful question, or offer a personal reflection.

    Varied: Don't always use the same formula. Sometimes agree, sometimes add a new perspective, and sometimes just react. Keep it fresh.

    Authentic: Emojis are fine if they feel natural. The goal is to sound like one person sharing their genuine thoughts. Never use heart emojis

    Non-Salesy: No promotions, ever. The goal is to build relationships, not sell.

Example Comments (as "I")

Here are a few examples of how this prompt would work in practice, written from an individual's point of view.

For a post about the risks of AI hallucinations in enterprise software:

    This is such a critical point. In my work, I've found that the best way to build trust is to design systems where AI assists humans, not just replaces them. A human in the loop makes all the difference.
the output should look like this
{
  {
    "comment":"<generated comment"
    "post_id":"<the post id of the post from the input>"
  }
  {
    "comment":"<generated comment"
    "post_id":"<the post id of the post from the input>"
  }
{
    "comment":"<generated comment"
    "post_id":"<the post id of the post from the input>"
  }
}
For a post where a founder shares a story about a difficult pivot:

    What a great story about resilience. It's easy to talk about listening to customers, but I think actually doing it when it means throwing away months of work takes real courage. Mad respect. üôè

For a technical post arguing for simpler, "boring" technology choices:

    I love this perspective. My experience has shown me that the temptation to use a shiny new tool is real, but a boring, reliable technology that my whole team understands is almost always the right call.

For a post encouraging managers to protect their team's focus time:

    Totally agree. My team has "no-meeting Wednesdays" and it's been a game-changer for my own deep work. It's amazing what just one long block of uninterrupted time can do for productivity. üöÄ
here are the posts {{ JSON.stringify($json.post1) || null}}{{ JSON.stringify($json.post2) || null }}{{ JSON.stringify($json.post3) || null}}

fields.Text:
"üöÄ 2,000+ Ready-to-Use n8n Automations & AI Agents (Free Download) 

Why spend weeks building workflows when someone already organised thousands of them clean, tested, and ready to plug in? 

Inside this goldmine: 

‚úÖ 2,053 workflows with clear names (no more ‚Äúworkflow_2051.json‚Äù)¬†
‚úÖ 365+ app integrations (Slack, Gmail, Airtable, HubSpot, and more)¬†
‚úÖ 29,000+ nodes mapped and categorised¬†
‚úÖ Organized folders by category: Marketing, Sales, Social, AI, Data, Communication, etc. 

This isn‚Äôt a random dump. It‚Äôs like walking into a workshop where every tool is labeled, sharpened, and ready to use. 

‚ö° Imagine: 

Social media automation in minutes¬†
CRM workflows you can deploy instantly¬†
AI agents you can run out-of-the-box 

It‚Äôs like a giant automation toolbox, organised, labeled, and ready to deploy. 

üí° Instead of reinventing the wheel, you can start from proven workflows, tweak them, and go live faster. 

Want the link to the full repo? 

üëâ Comment ‚ÄúAGENTS‚Äù and I‚Äôll send it your way

#Automation #n8n #AIagents #AIautomation #Productivity #Workflows #NoCode #MarketingAutomation #SalesAutomation #DataAutomation #TechTools #FutureOfWork"

json.Author: {"profile_url":"https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexd?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afsd_profile%3AACoAAABZ7nQBhbDs2hmZ-iM3FYsN3PLj_llfkyI"}
json.Text:
"AI isn‚Äôt just about automation. It‚Äôs about growth. Most people think AI is about saving time. The real shift? AI that learns with you.

When AI adapts, everything changes:

It doesn‚Äôt just solve today‚Äôs problems.
It grows with your business.
It makes smarter decisions tomorrow than it did yesterday.
That‚Äôs the difference between tools that finish tasks‚Ä¶ and systems that fuel progress.

Efficiency is nice. Evolution is better. Businesses that grasp this won‚Äôt just keep up‚Äîthey‚Äôll pull ahead.

#TechTalk #IndustryChallenges #LukSolutions #Innovation"

json.Author: {"profile_url":"https://www.linkedin.com/school/tutort/posts"}
json.Text:
"üöÄ AI Unicorns are redefining the startup landscapeüßë‚Äçüíª

Artificial Intelligence isn‚Äôt just transforming industries - it‚Äôs creating some of the world‚Äôs most valuable startups. From generative AI to automation and data intelligence, these unicorns are driving innovation at an unprecedented pace.
The rise of AI-first companies shows that the future belongs to those who can combine technology, creativity, and vision. Investors are betting big on startups that solve real problems using AI- improving productivity, decision-making, and customer experiencesüë®

But beyond the valuations lies a deeper message: sustainable success in AI requires purpose, ethics, and continuous innovation. The real winners will be the ones who use AI to empower people, not replace them‚åõ

The AI revolution is here ‚Äî and it‚Äôs just getting startedüëá

#ArtificialIntelligence #Startups #Innovation #AIRevolution #Unicorns #FutureOfTech #Leadership #Tutortacademy"

json.Author: {"profile_url":"https://www.linkedin.com/in/saadhsnain?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afsd_profile%3AACoAADHp5pcBaraZPL2SyWB94k6evwVB94zr6P0"}
json.Text:
"I‚Äôve been a little quiet on here for a while, and it‚Äôs long overdue that I reactivate LinkedIn and start sharing what I‚Äôve been up to.

A lot has been in the works simultaneously, and one of the most exciting chapters has been joining¬†Overdrive üèéÔ∏è

Overdrive is an Intelligence Studio building production-grade AI and automation systems that help VCs, enterprises, sales and HR teams scale smarter and focus on what counts.

A special thank you to¬†Rafael Posada, whose systems thinking has pushed me beyond the ‚Äúman with a hammer‚Äù mindset and taught me how to reach for the right tools at the right time.

And to¬†Georgiy Sekretaryuk, who's been an incredible mentor in automation: throwing me into the deep end with code, n8n, and complex workflows, and showing me that diving into new skills is the best way to grow.

A year ago, I‚Äôd never have guessed I‚Äôd be building automations and technical systems at this scale. üî•

Excited to share more soon about what we‚Äôre building."
